page.title: 08DAIRY FARM __ continued.
page.content: calcium to maintain its strength.Hoof problems are dealt with by clamping the beast,inspecting and giving necessary treatment. {FEEDING _}During the summer months the herd grazes a high proportion of the acreage.In October they are brought in for wintering.Sufficient straw is not produced from 30 acres of barley so Lancashire straw is bought for bedding.Finely chopped, four bales is sufficient per day.The cows feed on silage made in the summer.This is grass,cut and allowed to wilt for 24 hours,then blown into silage trucks and brought to the large silage shed. It is stacked tightly and covered in plastic sheeting to break down.Sap oozing from the silage drains into a tank which must not be allowed to enter water courses for fear of pollution.It is regularly removed and
